intro: Remirea rigidissima, commonly known as the rigid remirea, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is native to certain regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its upright, woody stems and trifoliate leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white pubescence. Its flowers are small, clustered, and typically have a pale yellow to greenish hue. Remirea rigidissima is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in its natural habitat.
